Question: This person was later arrested in 1500 and dismissed from his posts.
Hints: This person left Hispaniola on 24 April 1494, arriving at Cuba (which he named Juana) on 30 April.
The World Columbian Exposition in Chicago, 1893, commemorated the 400th anniversary of the landing of this person in the Americas.
"this person's claim to fame isn't that he got there first," explains historian Martin Dugard, "it's that he stayed.".
